Text:
One of the wisest books by any Western author I have ever read, the other being Meditations by Marcus Aurelius. 

I recommend getting the actual book however because the one I have atleast is annotated which greatly helps sorting out Thoreau's numerous subtle references to outside works.
Thanks a lot for this, nice to see some good audio books up here.

I've never read the book but heard much about it.
Thanks liguhy for uploading.

I'm afraid to say though that the narrator isn't very good. Has a bit of a whiny voice, and tries too hard to be dramatic, when most of the time it isn't called for.
